summary: Islamabad is Pakistan's capital city, with over 1.2 million people. It was built in the 1960s to replace Karachi as the capital. The city is divided into eight zones, including residential, commercial, and educational areas. Islamabad is known for its parks, forests, and landmarks like the Faisal Mosque, one of the world's largest mosques. It has a high cost of living and is mostly home to middle and upper-middle-class people. The city is also known for its safety and advanced surveillance system.
title: Islamabad
